content: Nepalese international footballer **Laken Limbu** (born 24 July 2002) is a [Nepalese](/wiki/Nepali_people) professional [footballer](/wiki/Association_footballer) who is currently playing as a [midfielder](/wiki/Midfielder_(association_football)) for Cambodian Premier League club [Kirivong Sok Sen Chey](/wiki/Kirivong_Sok_Sen_Chey_FC) and the [Nepal national team](/wiki/Nepal_national_football_team). ## Early life Born in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), Laken joined in the F17 Football Academy at the age of 12. After three years, he started training with the ANZA Soccer Academy. During his time in Singapore, Laken participated in football tournaments in [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden), [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia), and [Spain](/wiki/Spain), and also played in the Aaha Rara Gold Cup 2078 in [Nepal](/wiki/Nepal). ## Club career In early 2021, Laken moved to Nepal permanently, joining third division club [Jhapa](/wiki/Jhapa_FC) in the [C-Division League](/wiki/Martyr%27s_Memorial_C-Division_League) qualifiers. ### Three Star Club In September 2021, Laken signed with Nepal top-tier club [Three Star Club](/wiki/Three_Star_Club) and in his first [A-Division League](/wiki/Martyr%27s_Memorial_A-Division_League) season, he featured in eight matches and started. With a total playing time of 405 minutes, Laken made one assist. He played the full 90 minutes twice, against [Sankata Boys](/wiki/Sankata_Boys_S.C.) and [Nepal Police Club](/wiki/Nepal_Police_Club). He played 26 games in his second season, registering 3 goals and 4 assists. His performances earned him a callup to the Nepal national team. #### Loan to Machhindra In August 2023, Laken signed with [Machhindra](/wiki/Machhindra_F.C.) on a month loan deal. He make his debut in the [2023–24 AFC Cup qualifying play-offs](/wiki/2023%E2%80%9324_AFC_Cup_qualifying_play-offs) against Bhutanese club [Paro](/wiki/Paro_FC). ### Church Boys United On 1 February 2024, Laken signed with [Church Boys United](/wiki/Church_Boys_United). ### Delhi On 15 September 2024, Limbu signed his first overseas professional contract with Indian club [Delhi](/wiki/Delhi_FC) and will be playing for the club in the [I-League](/wiki/I-League). His moved was a success after a Singapore-based agency, Rookbook Sports help to smoothen the transfer for him to Delhi. ### Return to Jhapa In late March 2025, Limbu returned to his former club Jhapa. He scored a goal on 16 April in a 1–1 draw to [Lalitpur City](/wiki/Lalitpur_City_F.C.). ### Kirivong Sok Sen Chey On 15 July 2025, Limbu signed a contract with [Cambodian Premier League](/wiki/Cambodian_Premier_League) club [Kirivong Sok Sen Chey](/wiki/Kirivong_Sok_Sen_Chey_FC) where he will play under Singaporean head coach, [Satyasagara](/wiki/Satyasagara). ## International career On 15 June 2023, Laken made his international debut for [Nepal](/wiki/Nepal_national_football_team) in a friendly loss to the [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines_national_football_team). He was also part of the main squad for the [2023 SAFF Championship](/wiki/2023_SAFF_Championship). On 21 March 2025, Laken played in a friendly match against his birth country, [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_national_football_team) at the [Singapore National Stadium](/wiki/National_Stadium,_Singapore) where he was applause by the Singaporean fans after the final whistle. ## Personal life Laken was born in Singapore where his father was serving as the [Gurkha Contingent](/wiki/Gurkha_Contingent) in the [Singapore Police Force](/wiki/Singapore_Police_Force) at the point of time where he resides inside [Mount Vernon Camp](/wiki/Mount_Vernon_Camp). He attended several local school like Cedar Primary School and [Serangoon Garden Secondary School](/wiki/Serangoon_Garden_Secondary_School). After his father's service in Singapore ended, he returned to Nepal. ## Style of play Limbu has been known for his strength. ## Career statistics ### Club *As of 23 June 2023.*ClubSeasonDivisionLeagueOtherTotalAppsGoalsAppsGoalsAppsGoals[Three Star Club](/wiki/Three_Star_Club)[2021-22](/wiki/2021-22_Martyr%27s_Memorial_A-Division_League)[Martyr's Memorial A-Division League](/wiki/Martyr%27s_Memorial_A-Division_League)800080[2022-23](/wiki/2023_Martyr%27s_Memorial_A-Division_League)Martyr's Memorial A-Division League26300263Three Star Club Total34300343Career total34300343 ### International *As of 21 June 2023.*[Nepal national team](/wiki/Nepal_national_football_team)YearAppsGoals202320Total20 - Laken Limbu at Soccerway
title: Laken Limbu
